communication.messenger module¶

class communication.messenger.Messenger(socket)[source]¶

Bases: object

Handles all communications with another user.

Parameters:socket – Handle to the connection with the other user.
consume_message()[source]¶

Consumes the first message from the queue.

Returns:A message or None if the queue is empty.
consume_messages()[source]¶

Consumes all messages in the queue.

Returns:A list of messages or an empty list if the queue is empty.
message_callback()[source]¶

Does nothing by default. This function will be called when a message is received and can be overwriten to do any kind of necessary processing on received messages.

num_pending_messages()[source]¶
raise_last_error_if_any()[source]¶

Raises the last error that might have occured in the remote thread that deals with reception.

Raises:MessengerException – Will always be raised.
recv()[source]¶

Listens continuously for incoming messages and hands them over to the message callback.

run()[source]¶

Starts listening for messages.

send(message)[source]¶

Sends the given message to the remote user to which it’s connected.

Parameters:

message – The message to send.
Raises:
  • MessengerException – This error will be raised if there are connection issues while sending
  • the message.
set_message_callback(callback)[source]¶

Overwrites the current message callback.

Parameters:callback – The new function that’ll be called when a message is received.
stop()[source]¶

Stops listening for messages.
